intro: Viola elatior var. provincialis, commonly known as the Alpine violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It features heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces violet-blue or purple flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
